title: Baked Tofu With Peanut Sauce and Coconut-Lime Rice
directions: Heat the oven to 450 degrees and lightly brush a large rimmed sheet pan with oil.
In a small bowl, combine 4 tablespoons lime juice with 1/2 teaspoon salt and stir to dissolve the salt. Add the sliced peppers, a few cracks of black pepper and set aside.

In a medium bowl, use a whisk to combine 4 tablespoons lime juice, peanut butter, 1 tablespoon honey, miso, fish sauce (if using), habanero, ginger, 2 tablespoons oil and 3/4 cup water. Stir until smooth and season to taste with salt.

Arrange the tofu pieces in a single layer on the oiled baking sheet and season with salt. Spoon about 2 tablespoons of the peanut sauce over each. Be sure to cover the top, allowing the sauce to run down and coat the sides. Drizzle the tops with some oil, and roast until glaze is set, deep brown and caramelized along the edges, about 18 to 20 minutes. Use the remaining sauce in the bowl to make the dressing by whisking in the remaining lime juice and 1 tablespoon honey, and set aside.

In a small pot, combine the rice with 1 cup water and the coconut milk. Season with salt and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook over medium-low heat until the rice is just tender, about 12 to 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and allow the cooked rice to sit covered until you are ready to serve. Just before serving, add in the lime zest, half of the sliced scallions and fluff with a fork.
Divide the greens among bowls, and top with the rice and tofu. Spoon the peanut dressing over everything, and garnish with the drained pickled peppers and remaining sliced scallions.
Peanut sauce can be made 2 to 3 days in advance and stored refrigerated until ready to use.
ingredients: tablespoons peanut or vegetable oil, plus more for brushing the pan and drizzling
cup lime juice (from about 5 limes), and zest of 1 lime
baby bell peppers or 1 medium bell pepper (any color will do), stemmed and thinly sliced lengthwise
teaspoons chopped habanero pepper, stem and seeds removed, or 1 tablespoon sambal
(14-ounce) package extra-firm tofu, drained and sliced crosswise, 1/4-inch thick
cup long-grain rice like jasmine or basmati
cups peppery greens, like arugula, mizuna or baby mustard greens
